caption: Delicious food. Excellent bread. Impeccable service!!!!!
This place knows how to treat their customers. Regularly with a very kind attitude. The food is conveniently priced, regularly delightful and clean.

My wife and I tried this place recently when we wanted some pizza but were looking to try a spot we haven't tried before.  The pizza is a bit different than what you would typically expect, but it was absolutely delicious.  It reminded me of french bread pizza, but replace the french bread with an airy rosemary focaccia and you have an idea of what to expect.  We also tried the calamari, which despite not always being a dish that travels well (via takeout or delivery), was delicious and had a perfect light breading on it.  Dessert was great too, though we can't wait to try the gelato once they're making it again.  Customer service was great as well.  Highly recommend trying out this hidden neighborhood spot!
home made, hand crafted, call it what you will but the chef is an artist and this modest basement establishment is truly DC's best kept Italian dining secret

Came for brunch and stayed a few hours longer than anticipated! The food was fantastic, excellent quality. You must try the gelato, apparently the owner's son went to Italy to learn how to make it. And apparently he's a great student because it was delicious. Staff was polite and attentive. Worth the visit.
A delightful place to eat. Charming space, terrific food, friendly and competent service. Chanced upon it when walking thru the neighborhood with friends from out of town. What a find!
Hidden Gem. Italian restaurant Speakeasy is the only way to explain. One word. WOW!
I had a wonderful special of Italian sausage and polenta. My Manhattan was excellent. Service was first rate. Dinner was a completely wonderful experience.
Best egg sandwich in the city.

I just ate there the other night with friends having come from Venice Italy. I loved the owner and the food was amazing, so authentic. I plan to go back the next time I’m in Washington DC. My friends eat there all the time. And they love it.
Pictures online don't match up with the food.

Cute Italian bistro with delicious pasta options and gelato!  The staff was amazing! We made a reservation through Open Table... we arrived early and were seated immediately. Our waiter was very knowledgeable of the menu and took great care of us while we were there. The food was phenomenal!  I was visiting from out of town, but I hope to get to eat here again in the future.
Best Italian food in an unassuming little place. Best chingale since Tuscany! Service was do do. Seems to be family owned and we didn't rate as high others but the food made up for it
Bread dripping with oil, lasagna overcooked, and mushy.  Rigatoni boring.  Sorry but no return.

Absolutely wonderful. Fresh pasta with flavorful authentic sauce- incredible gnocchi, honestly out of this world. Good bread, solid house wine, reasonable prices. Their gelato is truly to die for- we had a chocolate orange that absolutely blew my mind. Don't want to miss this local gem.
Best homemade authentic Italian meal- very memorable - great experience!
Great service. Delicious food. Homemade Gelato to die for! And Masha is the cherry on top!!
Amazing food! Cute spot. Great service
Delicious! Enjoyed the eggplant Parmesan special. Sat outside on the sidewalk for dinner and wine with friends. Great service from our waiter (Michael?). Gelato was amazing too!

Hidden downstairs, Sorristro serves classic Italian food. There's limited seating, but the food is fresh and flavorful. The dining room and bar feel like a neighborhood joint, but the food quality is excellent. It's probably not ideal for large groups, but is great for a few friends.
They have Sicilian style pizza, and their gelato is also delicious!
As always, spectacular food and service.  Pietro and Stefano created delicious things to eat.  Masha is always friendly and welcoming.

By the far the most amazing Italian food I have ever had. Handmade noodles, sausage, and meatballs. All equally amazing. The owner was great, answered all of our questions and was extremely personable. The food came out hot and after sampling everything else my family had as well as my own, was consistently delicious. The service was great, the food arrived relatively quickly. The price was completely reasonable given the absolute quality of the food. We are all so glad we turned a corner and decided to give this place a try. It was some of the best food I have ever had, in a quiet, charming, family built restaurant.
Authentic Italian dining with friendly and personal service.  An awesome dining experience!
This is a small eatery with a quiet, possibly romantic ambiance. The food was amazing and the staff was very polite. I tried the pasta in white truffel sauce which was delectable.
Delightful! We enjoyed the Sicilian pizza and gelato. Great intimate atmosphere and great food!
Great food with a quaint atmosphere. Excellent staff.

We went here on a whim after a long day in DC and we were absolutely pleased. I had the gnocchi rosé which was absolutely amazing. The restaurant is beautiful inside and the staff was very kind. We will most definitely be coming back

Not a place for good treatment or reasonable service, even when supporting small business. Tea pots are stale tea pods but the dessert was nice. Didn't do dinner at all. Walked in at 4:15pm with the place empty. We were told to sit at the bar only b/c dinner parties were coming for 5pm. At 5:45pm, the 1st couple walked in. There was no trouble for us to sit at a table, especially when place is empty and no patrons or a party for at least another 1.5 hours. Won't be back. Avoid the middle aged small European woman, she can't be bothered.
Small. Intimate.  Fresh pasta,  great service & food at very modest price.

We are locals and this is our favorite restaurant in the neighborhood.  Authentic Italian food.  If they have eggplant parm when you are there, get it.  Reasonable portions, family atmosphere, great service.  Say hello to Pietro, the owner.  The gelato rivals anything I had in Italy.
I never write reviews online. However, this place kicks a**. Great food, great atmosphere, great location. Chef even came out to see if my steak was cooked right. 10/10 will be back.
Excellent food.  Very good selection of appetizers, main courses, and desserts on the menu.  Friendly and professional service.
Super friendly staff and great authentic food! You can tell its a great place by all the regulars they have!
Outdoor seating. We had brunch. Small menu, food was good. Relaxed service

I have only eaten weekend brunch here on a few occasions when visiting my son. As I walk by the lines waiting at Open City (where I have also eaten) I cross Connecticut Ave to Sorriso Bistro a few steps down. Easy to pass by. The coffee is excellent with free refills (unlike Open City where they charge you for another cup). The eggs and bacon were fine and reasonably priced. It's not a big seating area but I've never waited. If the wait is too long at the other place, cross the street and give it a try.
6 stars 👍 Excellent food, comfortable quaint atmosphere and both waitresses we're attentive and helpful.

Went for brunch, great service, food is nothing to rave about but it's ok. $12 endless mimisas ( mostly OJ) but they're not that vigilant about keeping you filled up- had my glass empty after almost every drink.
The food was absolutely amazing! Waitress was polite and the atmosphere was neat! 10 out of 10 would recommend. Other reviews were right it is a hidden gem
Thought the food was excellent at pretty reasonable prices, would definitely recommend if you're looking for Italian in this area

We went in just to get lunch after a day at the zoo, the employee was so hateful that I have half a mind to go back there and tell her so. She said how we had to move tables because we were at the only 3 person table and if we ( 3 of us ) weren’t gonna order 3 whole meals we couldn’t sit there. She hadn’t even let us order before she started being hateful towards us. She was the absolute worst waitress I’ve ever had in my life. They don’t deserve business and I don’t think anyone should eat there or be treated like that.

PAY ATTENTION: THIS PLACE IS AUTHENTIC.  My family and I went to Sorriso Bistro this afternoon. We were met by the lead chef, Stefano, who guided us through an authentic and delicious meal. From hand made pasta to pizza, to unbelievable gelato, Sorriso has it all. A cozy, intimate setting, it is as welcoming as it is delectable.

Rude employees.  Someone came outside and reprimanded my son because he was sitting quietly at an adjacent table to ours with his foot up on a pollen coated chair.  There was no one else even eating on the patio and it was late at night with business closing down.  This experience just exasperated the below average food.  I had the shrimp with pasta and needed a steak knife to cut the shrimp.  I will never go back to this establishment and neither should you!
Eat here. Family owned Italian restaurant with the best bread, pizza, hand made pasta, and service. Remember the cheesecake.
An overlooked gem in Woodley Park.  Great food, reasonable prices and friendly service.

First time there and absolutely love this place.  Reminded me of Italy.  The freshness especially.  When the waitress said made that morning that sild me but then the food came and that just went over the top! Definitely returning. Thursday was a great night to go because it was not busy and easy to find street parking. Can't wait to go back when it gets warmer to try their homemade gelato
Nice and cozy. The Gelato was good. Ordered a spaghetti pasta with shrimp; the shrimp was rather bland and tough, felt like it had just been thawed or not fully defrosted, but the sauce was good.
Lovely authentic lasagne.
Excellent
Love it , I'm home (Italy) at Sorriso!

I have lived in Woodley for 5 years now, and Sorriso is my favorite neighborhood gem. This place is exactly what a local neighborhood place should be: Great food, great service, and great value.  My husband and I come here for brunch at least once a month (sometimes far more...) and the staff is absolutely wonderful. Even though we are regulars, whenever we bring friends or a group, the staff treats them all just as well as us, and the service is always great. The food is no different from the service, and I've yet to regret a single order here.  Sorriso, please never change!
Amazing Italian food, even better Gelato!
Cozy little cafe right near the metro. The service was great and the Breakfast Egg sandwich was great. The coffee was really good too!
Best pizza I've ever had!!  And the gelato was just as good (if not better) than real Italian gelato!  Service was also friendly and professional.  Highly recommended!!!
Great Italian food, nice atmosphere. A little taste of Europe!
Fantastic food! Fast and great service! I would most definitely recommend this to anyone who likes pizzeria style food!

Easily the best Italian I have had outside of Rome (and I lived in Italy for four years, so I know Italian). The prices are a little higher than some other establishments, but the restaurant is family owned and operated, so it is well worth it.  Pietro and Rose Marie are extremely kind, and their son makes a great pizza! If you are there when the Veal Parmigiano is a special: do not hesitate.  It is phenomenal.  And no Sorriso experience is complete without their home-made gelato. Enjoy your evening here!

This place is overpriced and staff was very unprofessional when we dined there...Maybe some of there food is good, but I ordered the special not being told the price or knowing it and it was like $15 more than the most expensive thing on the menu, come on, I know that move....I'm never going back...place is dirt
Great atmosphere.  We ate upstairs at quaint table near window.  Food was very good.   Husband and wife team.  Wife was very sweet.
My favorite!!

(Translated by Google) Sorriso is my favorite Washington D.C. Italian restaurant. I like Sorriso pasta and pizza. Authentic Italian cuisine.  Simply marvelous Italian food.Sorriso is a friendly, warm, welcoming restaurant.  (Original) Sorrisoは私のお気に入りのワシントンD.C.イタリアンレストランです。Sorrisoのパスタとピザが好きです。本格的なイタリア料理あります。  Simply marvelous Italian food. Sorriso is a friendly, warm, welcoming restaurant.
I'm italian and i can say that the pizza is not italian.

We came at 4 and the place was empty. The service was good and the food was lovely, but the portions were excessively small. Two of us got the lasagna (one each) and we agreed that it was outstanding, but it was half the amount of food we expected for $14. Everyone left hungry. Would not recommend unless you're willing to buy two entrees instead of just one.

we had to park during the ice storm a few weeks ago and ended up here.  we both had to drive a few hours more in the ice, so chose not to drink, which seemed to turn the eastern-euro waittress even more condescending.  the food was horrible.  the salad was just arugala from a box with a little olive oil.    my chicken marsala seemed pretty obviously from frozen--just flattened chicken breast with a heavy, salty sauce and mushrooms, swimming in grease, and the accompanying vegetables were overcooked mush, and no pasta came with it. there was a breadbasket with cold bread and no butter, i guess to soak up all the extra oiliness. my husband didn't finish his pasta--a first--something with sausage in the sauce.   the meal without drinks cost $67.  i recommend AVOID.
Amazing coffee and brunch.
Nice people there
Amazing food, atmosphere, and waitstaff!
Amazing Italian pizzeria. Go see pietro.

The best Italian restaurant in DC hands down.  The food is impeccably prepared with only the freshest ingredients.  Flavors are authentic and perfectly balanced.  Sauces' integrity are kept intact and compliment just about every dish on the menu.  The wine list is superb yet straightforward.  It amazes me how Sorriso keeps their prices so affordable.  If this is your first time and you are an epicure looking for your  Italian food paradise, look no further. If you are a repeat customer, the menu allows you enough tantalizingly delicious choices for yout to explore time and time over again.  Here is a secret: ask for the Nutella pizza for dessert.  It will change your life and leave your speechless.  The owner and staff are very down to earth, unpretentious, and will create a personalized experience for you.  If you are looking for a cookie-cutter Italian experience, please move on because you will not appreciate this jewel and this place is not for you.
This place is fantastic.  Great espresso, excellent gelato, and some of the best homemade cheesecake I've ever had.

WOW! What a terrible evening... After so many great experiences in restaurants, in many countries around the world during our trip around the world, our last dinner was at Sorriso Restaurant. It was terrible. The food was mediocre and the portions were very small, the pizza was dry. After we told the manager about this his reaction was really rude. He told us he never had any complaints before, but after we checked on the internet, we easily found a lot of negative reviews.Our advice: DONT GO HERE!!.
Don't go here. The owner is the rudest guy I have ever met. He thinks he is king. Moreover price quality ratio is very poor !!!

When my best friend and I entered Sorriso, we were greeted by the hostess clad in a bright multicolored dress. She was delightful! She led us upstairs and to the back next to a window. It would seem that all the table are secluded, even though the restaurant is quite open. I had the pizza Diavola with house red wine and my friend ordered chicken cacciatore-- an off menu item the waitress was happy to comply with-- and a Riesling. The food was excellent and even the house wine was enjoyable. Our waitress was attentive without being overly so. We will definitely go back and urge anyone who has not gone yet to go.
Delicious Italian food, with casual atmosphere, reasonable prices and gluten free options!  Lovely waitress that was happy to let us sample wines.  We need more restaurants like this.
Lovely family-run place that does the Italian classics perfectly.
The best lasagna around, great food in an out of the way place.
Finally good espresso in Woodley Park.
Heavenly pizzas, private wines, and wonderful desserts at very reasonable prices make this a destination.   Go and enjoy.
